maml:description.maml:para: Adds a trusted policy signer for a tenant in Azure Attestation.
The Add-AzAttestationPolicySigner cmdlet adds a trusted policy signer for a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies the name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

Specifies the RFC7519 JSON Web Token containing a claim named "maa-policyCertificate" whose value is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key which contains a new trusted signing key to add. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing trusted signing keys.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

Specifies the RFC7519 JSON Web Token containing a claim named "maa-policyCertificate" whose value is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key which contains a new trusted signing key to add. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing trusted signing keys.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.

Specifies the RFC7519 JSON Web Token containing a claim named "maa-policyCertificate" whose value is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key which contains a new trusted signing key to add. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing trusted signing keys.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add a trusted signer for the Atteestation Provider named pshtest .

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
The Get-AzAttestationPolicy cmdlet gets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies the Location of the default attestation provider.
Specifies this is the request to a default attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet gets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies this is the request to a default attestation provider.
Specifies the Location of the default attestation provider.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet gets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the policy for Attestation Provider pshtest for Tee type SgxEnclave .

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the trusted policy signers from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
The Get-AzAttestationPolicySigners cmdlet gets the trusted policy signers from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies the Location of the default attestation provider.
Specifies this is the request to a default attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies this is the request to a default attestation provider.
Specifies the Location of the default attestation provider.
Specifies the name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.

Get-AzAttestationPolicySigners -Name pshtest -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the trusted policy signers for the Attestation Provider pshtest in Resource Group psh-test-rg . Note that there are no trusted signers for this Attestation Provider.

Get-AzAttestationPolicySigners -Name pshtest2 -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a trusted policy signer for a tenant in Azure Attestation.
The Remove-AzAttestationPolicySigner cmdlet removes a trusted policy signer for a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies the name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

Specifies the RFC7519 JSON Web Token containing a claim named "maa-policyCertificate" whose value is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key which contains a trusted signing key to remove. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing trusted signing keys.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

Specifies the RFC7519 JSON Web Token containing a claim named "maa-policyCertificate" whose value is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key which contains a trusted signing key to remove. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing trusted signing keys.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove a trusted signer for the Attestation Provider named pshtest .

maml:description.maml:para: Resets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestationn.}
The Reset-AzAttestationPolicy cmdlet resets the user defined attestation policy from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet resets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the JSON Web Token describing the policy document to reset.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the JSON Web Token describing the policy document to reset.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet resets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the JSON Web Token describing the policy document to reset.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Reset the policy to the default for the Attestation Provider pshtest for Tee type SgxEnclave .
If the Attestation Provider pshtest is configured to use the isolated trust model, reset the policy to the default for Tee type SgxEnclave by including a signed policy.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestationn.
The Set-AzAttestationPolicy cmdlet sets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet sets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the policy document to set. The policy format can be either Text or JSON Web Token (JWT).
Specifies the format for the policy, either Text or JWT (JSON Web Token). The default policy format is Text.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. Four types of environment are supported: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the policy document to set. The policy format can be either Text or JSON Web Token (JWT).
Specifies the format for the policy, either Text or JWT (JSON Web Token). The default policy format is Text.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. Four types of environment are supported: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet sets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the policy document to set. The policy format can be either Text or JSON Web Token (JWT).
Specifies the format for the policy, either Text or JWT (JSON Web Token). The default policy format is Text.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. Four types of environment are supported: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the user defined policy for TEE type SgxEnclave for Attestation Provider pshtest using a text policy format (default).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $policyjwt = Get-Content -Path .\custom.sgx.policy.jwt.format.txt Set-AzAttestationPolicy -Name pshtest -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg -Tee SgxEnclave -Policy $policyjwt -PolicyFormat JWT

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the user defined policy for TEE type SgxEnclave for Attestation Provider pshtest using a JWT policy format.
